abstracts.cdata!:
The project had two objectives: Improve
            the operational efficiency of Skopje Vodovod, the largest
            water and wastewater utility in the country, to enable it to
            provide quality service at affordable prices to the
            population; and Provide a sound basis for the future
            development of the solid waste sector in Skopje. As per the
            Bank's policy (OP 13.00), due to the 18 month delay in
            effectiveness, the Loan and Credit Agreements lapsed. The
            approach taken by the City Council to focus on institutional
            aspects was correct and as a result it was reflected in the
            project design. However, the willingness to implement the
            institutional reform waned as the socio political situation
            in the country changed with the internal strife. Priorities
            and political alliances shifted after the Board approval
            which was the primary cause for the Loan and Credit
            Agreements to lapse. Even if the operating company (OC) was
            not included as part of the project design, without the
            political willingness, it would be difficult to bring about
            efficiency improvements in the water utility. Commitment
            from the city would be required to reduce unaccounted for
            water, increase tariffs and bill collection rates, improve
            employee productivity etc., by not agreeing to sign the
            Project Agreement, the City Council demonstrated that they
            were not ready to address these difficult issues. In a
            recent assessment made by the Government, urban poverty
            remains as a key priority. There are about 100 slum
            settlements in the country where citizens lack access to
            safe drinking water and sanitation and sanitation, and
            environmentally friendly solid waste management services.

3044097.trustfund:
TF029660-PHRD-WATER SUPPLY &
            SEWERAGE PROJ.,TF036886-MACEDONIA, FORMER YUGOSLAV
            REP.-WATER AND SEWERAGE PROJECT,TF04046-FYR MACEDONIA:  WATER SUPPLY,TF040466-FYR MACEDONIA:  WATER SUPPLY,TF040467-MACEDONIA, FYR:  WATER SUPPLY

abstracts.cdata!:
The Water Utility Improvement Project
            will enhance the operational efficiency of the Skopje
            Vodovod - largest water, and wastewater utility in Macedonia
            - to provide quality service, at affordable prices, and,
            provide sound bases for the development of the solid waste
            sector in Skopje. The project components are: 1) water, and
            wastewater development, which includes five subcomponents:
            a) water supply rehabilitation, through the construction of
            an additional water supply feeder line, and sewerage
            rehabilitation; b) financing water network efficiency
            improvements, and sewerage rehabilitation by the Operating
            Fund - subject to disbursements conditionality, based on
            contracting effectiveness between the City of Skopje,
            Vodovod, and the operating company; c) Vodovod
            restructuring, through technical assistance (TA), and
            equipment supply; d) engineering, and construction
            supervision services; and, e) project management support; 2)
            development of a strategy, and action plan for the
            implementation of solid waste management in Skopje,
            including an assessment for private sector involvement. TA
            will be provided for the completion of this strategy, and,
            the expansion of services by the Komunalna Higiena operating
            company, will require investments in equipment, waste
            containers, and sanitary landfills, to enable services to
            underserved low-income groups; and, 3) project management,
            and operating costs, to cover audit, consulting, and
            incremental services.

1346276.trustfund:
TF040467-MACEDONIA, FYR:  WATER SUPPLY,TF040466-FYR MACEDONIA:  WATER SUPPLY,TF04046-FYR MACEDONIA:  WATER SUPPLY,TF036886-MACEDONIA, FORMER YUGOSLAV

repnme.cdata!:
Macedonia - Water Utility Improvement
            Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
It is expected that the overall impacts
            of the Water Utility Improvement Project will be beneficial,
            since the sewerage projects will improve sanitary conditions
            on the high density residential areas in Skopje, Bitola, and
            Prilep. Nonetheless, during construction, adverse
            environmental impacts will occur, namely noise, and dust
            pollution, as well as pollution due to increased traffic on
            local roads. In addition, groundwater abstraction from the
            Vardar River, will adversely affect river flows. The
            Environmental Assessment addresses separately each of the
            three locations, providing the environmental baseline
            encountered, and, in accordance with the country's
            laws, and regulations, proposes mitigating measures as
            follows: 1) monitoring of groundwater levels, to establish
            the effect - on the river flows - of using groundwater for
            irrigation. Maximum abstraction levels are specified, to be
            phased out during a two year period; 2) construction should
            be limited to daylight schedules as a noise abatement
            measure; appropriate covers will control dust emissions;
            and, an efficient traffic management plan will limit
            congestion, and reduce public risk; 3) ecological protection
            include fencing, and the provision of alternative habitats,
            or relocation of flora, and fauna.

display_title.display_title:
Macedonia - Water Utility
            Improvement Project : environmental assessment (Vol. 2) :
            Environmental assessment and public consultation
